title: 106_hr4803
content: The "National Flood Insurance Program Fairness Act" may be cited as the short title. It includes provisions for notification and appeal of map changes. Subsection (h) of section 1360 of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to require the Director to notify affected communities of any changes to flood insurance map panels and provide a process for appealing such changes. Notification must be sent to the chief executive officer of each community by registered mail and published in the Federal Register. The Director must notify communities of changes to flood insurance map panels through registered mail and the Federal Register. Communities have a 30-day period to appeal changes by submitting a written objection to the Director. The Director must notify communities of changes to flood insurance map panels through registered mail and the Federal Register. Communities have a 30-day period to appeal changes by submitting a written objection or request for additional time to obtain information. The Director will respond to the appeal within 30 days by denying the objection, revising the changes, or granting additional time for the community to gather evidence. The chief executive officer of the community will be notified in writing of the Director's determination. The Director notifies communities of changes to flood insurance map panels through registered mail and the Federal Register. Communities can appeal changes by submitting a written objection or request for additional time to gather evidence. The Director will respond within 30 days by denying the objection, revising the changes, or granting additional time. The chief executive officer of the community will be notified in writing of the Director's determination. The Director notifies property owners affected by changes to flood insurance map panels within 30 days of a final determination. The notification includes the property's flood zone status, insurance purchase requirements, information on obtaining coverage, and estimated costs. Final determinations under this subparagraph include the expiration of the period without objection, denial of an objection, or revision of changes to flood insurance map panels. Changes to flood insurance map panels take effect upon determination. The insurance map panel changes take effect based on whether they result in the initial applicability of flood insurance requirements, or the elimination of such requirements. Property owners may be reimbursed for costs incurred in appeals. Property owners affected by changes to flood insurance map panels may be reimbursed for expenses incurred in appeals, such as surveyors or engineers. The Director will determine the reimbursement amount based on the successful portion of the appeal compared to the entire appeal, applying this ratio to the average cost of similar services in the community. SEC. 4. NOTIFICATION OF ESTABLISHMENT OF FLOOD ELEVATIONS. Section 1363 of the National Flood Insurance Act of 1968 is amended to require the Director to notify communities of proposed flood elevations for land use purposes. This includes providing notice to the chief executive officer of each affected community and publishing the elevations in the Federal Register for appeal. The Director is required to notify communities of proposed flood elevations for land use purposes, including providing information on how to obtain copies of the elevations and the process for appealing changes. The elevations must also be published in a local newspaper.
